intro: Cyrtandra hellwigii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and evergreen leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting various pollinators. Cyrtandra hellwigii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, contributing to biodiversity and habitat structure.
